name: Samsung C-Lab
title: Separation with Spinoff Path

classification.classificationRationale: Employees leave their execution roles for a defined period of exploration (full year, not 20% time), then either return to operations, spin off as an independent company, or get absorbed back. This is textbook temporal ambidexterity: individuals cycle between exploration and execution phases. The time-boxed structure with clear exit paths is the defining characteristic of Model 7.

description:
Samsung C-Lab is an internal incubator launched in 2012 after Samsung management's Silicon Valley experiences. It operates on two structural innovations: internal holacracy and a defined spinoff pathway.

The selection process is itself innovative: employees vote on ideas, experts review finalists, and a selected audience plays 'venture capitalists' deciding whether to invest. Selected employees get a full year away from regular duties — 100% dedicated time, not 20% time. Teams operate with flat hierarchy ('Each team has a leader and project members. That's it.') and can recruit from outside Samsung if needed talent isn't available internally.

The defining structural feature is the clear exit mechanism: 20% of C-Lab projects have become independent companies. Since 2015, promising projects can spin off as fully-fledged startups. This creates a three-path outcome for exploration work: reintegration into Samsung operations, spinoff as an independent venture, or termination — giving entrepreneurial employees clear endpoints rather than indefinite limbo.

observableMarkers.reportingStructure: Flat structure within C-Lab teams. Leader + project members only. Separate from Samsung's main hierarchy during exploration period.
observableMarkers.resourceAllocation: Full-year commitment for selected employees. Can recruit external talent. Venture-style selection process.
observableMarkers.timeHorizons: One year of dedicated exploration. Post-exploration: spinoff timeline varies. Program running since 2012.
observableMarkers.decisionRights: Employee voting for idea selection. Flat hierarchy during exploration. Clear exit criteria for spinoff vs. reintegration.
observableMarkers.metrics: 959 total ventures supported (423 in-house, 536 external via C-Lab Outside) as of February 2025. 100+ graduated startups since 2012. 20% of projects become independent companies.

layers.label: Spinoff Path Formalized
layers.summary: C-Lab added formal spinoff mechanism, allowing promising projects to become fully-fledged startups. Prior to this, reintegration into Samsung was the primary exit path.

openQuestions: What is the return-to-operations experience like for employees whose projects don't spin off?
How does C-Lab Outside (external program) differ structurally from the internal program?
What is the survival rate of spun-off companies after 3-5 years?
How does Samsung's main org view C-Lab alumni — are they promoted, or is there stigma?
taxonomyFeedback: Samsung C-Lab validates Model 7 (Tiger Teams) as distinct from Model 5 (Product/Venture Lab). The key difference is that C-Lab participants are temporarily separated from execution roles and may return — vs. Model 5 where the lab is a permanent structure. The spinoff path blurs this slightly, but the defining feature is the temporal cycling of individuals.
The 'C-Lab Outside' program (external startups) may warrant separate treatment or a note that Model 7 can evolve to include external participants.
